Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of parts of two dancers standing back to back; added red on chest of figure at left, whose left arm is lowered; most of black has disappeared leaving only remnants and outlines in dilute.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 108, no. A170)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.020) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
